meanings.definition: Discarded or thrown away as no longer useful or needed.
meanings.sent1: The old, scrapped car sat in the junkyard.
meanings.sent2: The scrapped toy was no longer safe to play with.
meanings.sent3: The scrapped idea of having a picnic in the rain was quickly replaced with a movie night indoors.
meanings.sent4: Her scrapped dreams of becoming an astronaut were replaced with a passion for marine biology.
meanings.sent5: The scrapped painting lay forgotten in the attic, gathering dust.

meanings.definition: To abandon or cancel a plan or project.
meanings.sent1: They scrapped the idea of going to the beach due to the stormy weather.
meanings.sent2: The team decided to scrap the project and start fresh with a new approach.
meanings.sent3: After realizing the complexity of the task, they scrapped the plan to build a treehouse in one day.
meanings.sent4: She had to scrap her travel plans when her passport expired unexpectedly.
meanings.sent5: The company had to scrap the launch event due to unforeseen logistical issues.

meanings.definition: To dismantle or break down for parts or materials.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic scrapped the old car for spare parts.
meanings.sent2: They had to scrap the broken computer for recycling.
meanings.sent3: In a creative twist, they scrapped the old furniture to build a unique sculpture.
meanings.sent4: The artist decided to scrap the failed painting and use the canvas for a new masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The team had to scrap the prototype and start from scratch to improve the design.
